meanings.definition: Composed, performed, or uttered without advance preparation
meanings.sent1: The extemporised speech was delivered confidently by the student.
meanings.sent2: Her extemporised piano performance impressed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The extemporised joke made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: His extemporised dance moves on the stage were like a burst of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The extemporised artwork captured the essence of spontaneity.

meanings.definition: Improvised or done without prior planning
meanings.sent1: We were amazed by the extemporised decorations at the event.
meanings.sent2: The extemporised solution to the problem worked surprisingly well.
meanings.sent3: She extemporised a song on the spot that everyone enjoyed.
meanings.sent4: The extemporised decision turned out to be the best one they made.
meanings.sent5: His extemporised cooking experiment resulted in a delicious dish.
